column45: For any feedback you'd like to provide, be it potential bugs, opinions or comments, use the text box below.
I think it might be useful to provide a small explanation about the different concepts for each challenge.
I found a bug in test 1.3 with the out of bounds box (I did not think to try to replicate it in another test until now), and I described it in my failed attempt comment.

I'd have like to have had either inside the game or otherwise a way to be reminded of the meaning of the different types of coverage.
Adding and removing checkers through multiple clicks of the add button doesn't seem very intuitive at start. Can adapt just fine though.
Otherwise, great work.
Small opinion: At first, I did not understand the exercise, I thought the goal was to check the title, the yellow box where the goal appears looks like a warning element.

I think overall, the structure of the capsule is very well done. However, I think the puzzle scenarios it presents don't always lead to the correct interpretations. There are a lot of puzzles that you can solve without necessarily being able to validate the test objective correctly.

I have a few comments related to the interaction with the pages "outside" the game environment itself.
When testing the login page in dark mode, the "small" letters that provided context to the username and password inputs were not visible (maybe they should change to white like in other screens).
The dropdown of the Auxiliary Functions tab in the "How to Play" page was not working for me, and it was always showing the "isTriangle" function.
At last, I feel like it would be nice to have a "go back arrow" button in all the "menu pages" (credits, how to play, challenges) instead of the only option to return to the "main menu" being through the browser itself.
Other than those small comments, I think the overall interface and experience of GAMFLEW are very nice and well-built, and I would definitely use this game to learn software testing if I had the opportunity. Good Job!

I have one comment about the usability of the user interface. When we come out of a challenge on the 'test file 2: Is Board valid?', the modal for 'test file 1: Is move valid?' is opened. From there, I must scroll down to open the test file 2 modal. You can save the previous state of the previous test file modal opened so that the scrolling time is saved.
